summary:
Anki - be thankful she\'s on your side.

Companion - can marry - essential or non essential.

In Whiterun - Temple of Kynareth
descriptionHtml:
Endorse if you like her.  Comments and feedback welcome.

Anki levels with you and can be married.  She is essential (main file) or non essential (optional file - does not require main).  She can be found at the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun (next to the Gildergreen tree).

Anki will conjure dremora or wolves depending on level or raise the dead to fight for you. 

[IMG]http://i214.photobucket.com/albums/cc76/sideshowstew/Anki-Conjcombined_zpsee687ddb.jpg[/IMG]


She will use wards and frost to protect herself, her wards absorb magicka.  

[IMG]http://i214.photobucket.com/albums/cc76/sideshowstew/Anki-wards-combined_zpse77aa894.jpg[/IMG]


When pressured into melee she will wield and ward, or dual wield if low on magicka.  She can also heal.


[IMG]http://i214.photobucket.com/albums/cc76/sideshowstew/Anki-dual-frost-combined_zps95da39ad.jpg[/IMG]


She starts with arch-mage robes but will wear any armour given to her (as all will protect better than robes).  She uses buffs that work best with robes, though.  She is designed to not require any additional equipment.



Required mod:

ApachiiSkyHair: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168/?tab=2&navtag=/ajax/modimages/?user=0|:|id=10168
Requires ApachiiSkyHair_v-1_4_Full and optional ApachiiSkyHairFemale_v_1_0



Recommended mods:

The Mods needed to replicate the screenshots are:

Better Females by Bella: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2812/?tab=2&navtag=/ajax/modimages/?user=0|:|id=2812

Calientes Female Body Mod Big Bottom Edition - CBBE: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666/?tab=2&navtag=/ajax/modimages/?user=0|:|id=2666

Killer Keos Skimpy Arch Mage robes (normal)
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3654/?tab=3&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fmodimages%2F%3Fuser%3D0%26id%3D3654#content



Installation:

Use NMM, it\'s much easier.  If going manual, drop the esp into the data folder, follow the folder structure for the NIF and dds files.  If you don\'t know where these go, you shouldn\'t be installing manually.  



Want more companions and player homes?  Try my other mods:

The Havenites:
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22034/?tab=4&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fthread_id%3D752876%26mod_id%3D22034

Gravesend:
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24100/?tab=4&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fthread_id%3D782748%26mod_id%3D24100


Credits:

See required and recommended mods.  These guys are awesome.
author: Sideshowstew
